intro: Bothriocline concinna, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many daisies and sunflowers. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy surface. Its yellow flowers are composite, consisting of many small florets arranged in a circular pattern. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides.
